title.rendered: 15 Best Things To Do In Bangalore

content.rendered:
Bangalore – known as the Silicon Valley of India – has a lot to offer. Despite the traffic, Banglorians love the city and speak highly of it. Places to visit in Bangalore are plenty, and its rich culture will make you want to move here. As Karnataka’s capital city, it’s also a well known IT hub and some of the world’s major info tech corporations operate out of the city. Apart from being a tech city, it’s also home to many tourist attractions and there are lots of noteworthy restaurants in Bangalore. Read on to discover the best things to do in Bangalore!

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Bangalore

Exciting Outdoor Activities in Bangalore

1. Lal Bagh

The garden is 240 acres of land with beautiful attractions such as the glasshouse, ancient trees, and unique tropical plants. Translating to ‘Red Garden,’ it gets its name from the abundance of red roses in the garden. Certainly, one of the best places to visit in Bangalore when you want a peaceful day out.

Know more

2. Adventure Camping in Kanakapura

Kanakapura is one of the most beautiful places to visit in Bangalore for a camping trip. It also provides plenty of opportunities for outdoor activities before retiring for the night. Trekking, bicycle excursions, rappelling, kayaking, canoeing, and other team-building activities are among the options. It offers some the best things to do in Bangalore whether you’re travelling solo or in a group.

Website

3. Cubbon Park

Nothing beats the simple joys of being surrounded by fresh breezes and rich foliage. At this lovely park, spending time with friends and family on a picnic is undoubtedly one of the best things to do in Bangalore.

Plan your visit

Related: 5 New York Hiking Trails to Add to Your Traveling Bucket-list

Adventurous Sports Scene in Bangalore

1. Camping at Nandi Hills

Signing up for an outdoor camping trip to the beautiful Nandi Hills is one the best things to do in Bangalore. Interesting hikes, delectable meals, luxurious lodgings, and thrilling activities such as zip line and bonfires will make you never want to leave!

Buy Tickets

2. Paragliding in Nandi Hills

The best paragliding experience is considered to be in Nandi Hills, which is a sporty place to take up a variety of adventure activities. Almost 60 km from the city, it offers one of the best things to do in Bangalore for the thrill seekers out there.

Buy Tickets

3. Shilhaandara Resort

Take part in zorbing, chess, darts, rope courses, table tennis and other indoor and outdoor games here. Unique activities include kite-flying, a swimming pool, archery and even a rain dance floor. Before heading for dinner at the restaurants in Bangalore, enjoy a taste of the delicious snacks and beverages here.

Website

Related: 5 Ways To Save Money For Your Next Vacation

Must Visit Museums in Bangalore

1. The National Gallery of Modern Art

Home to an impressive collection of Indian modern art, this is one of the history-rich places to visit in Bangalore. The gallery also hosts exhibitions and talks, dance performances and live painting by famous artists. One of the best things to do in Bangalore is to go on guided tours here.

Website

2. ISKCON Temple

One of the best things to do in Bangalore is to visit the ISKCON temple. Besides being a famous temple, it’s also a place where you can spend hours soaking in the culture of the country. Don’t miss the Vedic museum and the exhibitions here.

Plan your visit

3. Bangalore Palace

Built in 1887 and spread across 45,000 square feet, the architecture is inspired by Tudor and Scottish Gothic architecture and style. You’ll find beautiful paintings and carvings with floral motifs inside. Lush green scenery makes this one among the best places to visit in Bangalore for rock concerts, cultural programs, and exhibitions.

Plan your visit

Related: How to Make Money for the Holidays – Pandemic Edition

Cultural Places To Visit in Bangalore

1. Tipu Sultan’s Summer Palace

If you’re a fan of Indo-Islamic architecture and history, head to Tipu Sultan’s Summer Palace. Beautiful architecture, floral patterns, and a museum dedicated to king of Mysore, Tipu Sultan.

Website

2. Ranga Shankara

Opened by the wife of late Shankar Nag, a famous Kanada actor, this theater is truly among the best places to visit in Bangalore. The theater is known to be one of the most progressive, accommodating spaces for Indian and global performances.

Website

3. Bangalore International Centre

The Bangalore International Centre (BIC) hosts all kinds of events! The best things to do in the city are compiled in this one-stop destination. From Nobel laureates talks, jazz music performances, book readings to talks on archaeology for the children, all for free!

Events

Related: The Eco-Life: How to Minimize Expenses While on Vacation

Explore Popular Bars, Shopping Centers & Restaurants in Bangalore

1. Toit

Toit is one of the city’s most popular bars, located in the most popular neighborhood. The bar is open until quite late at night, perfect for long catch-ups with friends. Stop by Toit for a pint of beer after a busy day covering all the best things to do in Bangalore!

Menu

2. MG Road

One of the most iconic shopping areas in the city, shopping at MG Road is one of the best things to do in Bangalore. Shop for homeware, branded clothes, sarees, original silks, accessories, and toys. You can also pick up authentic handicrafts and artworks.

Know more

3. Eat Out at VV Puram Food Street

Forget eating at fancy restaurants in Bangalore, and head to VV Puram to experience local cuisine at its finest! Eating at Bangalore’s most popular food street spots is one of the best things to do late at night. For those who enjoy eating street cuisine, this is a must-visit location. After 7 p.m., the area comes alive with many looking to enjoy vegetarian local cuisine.

Know more

Do you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find the best things to do in Bangalore? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!
